document.docAuthor: Trombetta, Alana De Souza, Páez, Fernanda Polli, Santos, Sandro & Teixeira, Gustavo Monteiro
document.docTitle: Aegla nebeccana Trombetta & Páez & Santos & Teixeira 2019, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: Aegla nebeccana n. sp. (Crustacea, Aeglidae) from Ivaí Basin, Paraná, Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Aegla nebeccana n. sp. (Crustacea, Aeglidae) from Ivaí Basin, Paraná, Brazil

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type-Material .
Holotype :
MZUEL 222 , male ( CLE 17.6 mm ), Brazil , Paraná , Borrazópolis , Paraná River basin, Ivaí River sub-basin, 24°01’32.85”S , 51°36’46.98”W ,
375 m
, coll. G. Teixeira.

Paratypes
(all the same locality and collector as the holotype )
:
MZUEL216 , 1 male ( CLE 20.2 mm ),
April 2016
.
MZUEL218 , 1 male ( CLE 15.4 mm ),
August 2015
.
MZUEL219 , 1 male ( CLE 10.2 mm ),
June 2016
.
MZUEL222 , 1 male ( CLE 17.6 mm ), 1 female ( CLE 9 mm ),
August 2016
.
MZUEL223 , 2 males ( CLE 10.5–16.1 mm ),
April 2016
.
MZUEL224 , 3 males ( CLE 16.0– 14.5 mm ), 3 females ( CLE 13.0– 14.1 mm ),
January 2015
.
MZUEL225 , 1 male ( CLE 12.4 mm ),
April 2014
.
MZUEL214 , 1 female ( CLE 12.5 mm ),
September 2015
.
MZUEL 220 mm , 1 female ( CLE 14.8 mm ),
May 2015
.
MZUEL226 , 6 females ( CLE 12.7–15.5 mm ),
August 2016
.
MZUEL227 , 6 females ( CLE 10.6 –17.0 mm),
July 2016
.

Non-Type Material
. Genetic voucher: Bold Systems access AEGIV001-19 , AEGIV002-19 (same locality and collector as the holotype , specimens are deposited in the crustacean collection of the Federal University of Santa Maria , Rio Grande do Sul , Brazil , catalogue number 480)
.
Geographical distribution. This species is presently known only from Lageadão River, State of Paraná , Paraná River hydrographic basin, Ivaí River sub-basin.

Diagnosis. Carapace slightly protuberant. Triangular rostrum with narrow base, slightly curved downwards. Prominent rostral carina beginning at height of protogastric lobes extending to the apex of the rostrum. Protogastric lobes developed and protruding. Orbital sinus slightly shallow, externally limited by orbital tubercle. Shallow extra-orbital sinus. First hepatic lobe delimited by deep groove, followed by 2° evident and 3° hepatic lobe sparsely delimited with modest indicative of demarcation. Anterior angle of ventral margin of epimeron 2 unarmed. High palm, palmar crests of major cheliped rectangular. Palmar crest of minor cheliped rectangular or subdisciform. Carpal crest of carpus weakly marked in distal region. Merus of cheliped with ventromesial border ornate with distal spine followed by tubercles. Ventromesial face of ischium of cheliped ornate, with proximal and distal prominent tubercle and up to 2 rudimentary tubercles between them. Narrow uropod.

FIGURE 2 .
Aegla nebeccana
n. sp.
, male holotype, CLE 17.6 mm (MZUEL 222). Dorsal view of cephalothorax and anterior portion of abdomen.

FIGURE 3 .
Aegla nebeccana
n. sp.
, male holotype, CLE 17.6 mm (MZUEL 222). A, lateral view of the cephalothorax. B, uropods and telson. C, ventral view ischium of major cheliped (left). D, third and fourth thoracic sternites. E, dorsal view of second abdominal epimeron.

FIGURE 4 .
Aegla nebeccana
n. sp. ,
male holotype, CLE 17.6 mm. A, dorsal view. B, ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description of male holotype .
Carapace moderately protruding; gastric region protruding; irregular dorsal region with punctuations (CC = 20.7 mm ; CLE = 17.6 mm ) ( Figs 3A , 5A, D ). Front LPC/LF = 1.53. Rostrum triangular, narrow base (RBW/LMR = 0.97), curved slightly downwards, extending beyond apex of compound eyes (total rostrum length = 3.7 mm ) ( Fig. 5A ). High rostral carina, beginning at level of protogastric lobes ( Figs 5A, C ), extending to near apex, with two 2 parallel rows of scales, changing to 1 row on distal portion near apex; sub-rostral process developed.

Epigastric prominences inconspicuous, demarcated by few scales ( Figs 5A, B ). Protogastric lobes developed and protruding, ornamented by few scales ( Figs 3A , 5A, B ). First hepatic lobe delimited anteriorly by distinct groove; 2 nd hepatic lobe distinct; 3 rd hepatic lobe modestly marked.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5 .
Aegla nebeccana
n. sp.
, male holotype, CLE 17.6 mm (MZUEL 222). A, dorsal view of anterior region of cephalothorax. B, lateral view of anterior portion of cephalothorax. C, dorsal view of orbital region. D, lateral view of anterior portion of carapace. E, dorsal view of carapace. F, dorsal view of second abdominal epimeron. Note: C, prominent for orbital sinus, extra-orbital sinus and anterolateral spine reaching base of cornea (arrow); F, anterolateral angle of second abdominal epimeron unarmed (arrow).

subSubSection.paragraph: Epibranchial sub-rectangular area, with scales on margins. Lateral margin of anterior branchial area with scarce scale and setae, posterior area with scarce setae.

Anterior angle of ventral margin of epimeron 2 unarmed ( Fig. 3E , 5F ), with small scales and setae. Ventrolateral margin slightly concave. Posterior angle of ventral margin apically rounded, unarmed, ornamented with setae.
Telson divided by longitudinal suture. Narrow uropod (MWE/MW= 0.93) ( Fig. 3B , 6A ).

Anterior extremity of 3 rd sternite tapered, with tufts of long setae ( Fig. 3D , 6B ). Fourth thoracic sternite with ornamented margin with tufts of long setae, median region slightly flattened, with small prominence between tufts of setae and small tufts of short setae at posteromedially.

Pereopods 2–4 with outer and ventral margins of dactylus, propodus and carpus with longitudinal lines of short setae and scales; outer margin of merus with long setae, ventral margin with small distal tubercles; ventromesial face of ischium of 2 nd pereiopod with tubercles and tufts of long setae.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 6 .
Aegla nebeccana
n. sp.
male holotype, CLE 17.6 mm (MZUEL222) A, uropods and telson divided by longitudinal suture. B, third and fourth thoracic sternites.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variations. The anterolateral angle of the carapace, with a conical spine protruding anteriorly, may not reach the base of the cornea ( Figs 8A, B ). In 24 of the 29 specimens analyzed in the paratypic series, the conical spine reaches the base of the cornea.
The shape of the areola from trapezoidal (n = 3) to sub-rectangular (n = 26). The cardiac area may also vary from trapezoidal (n = 7) to sub-rectangular (n = 22).
The uropod varies between narrow (n = 22) and wide (n = 7).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 7 .
Aegla nebeccana
n. sp.
male holotype, CLE 17.6 mm (MZUEL 222) A, dorsal view dactylus and propodus of major cheliped (left). B, dorsal view dactylus and propodus of minor cheliped (right). C, dorsal view carpus of major cheliped. D, dorsal view carpus of minor cheliped; E, ventral view ischium of major cheliped. F, ventral view ischium of minor cheliped. Note: A and B, palmar crest (arrow); E and F, tubercles on cheliped ischium (arrows)

subSubSection.paragraph: All measurements are summarized in Table 1 and their relationships between the different body dimensions are summarized in Table 2
Biology. Unknown.
Etymology. Named in reference to the NEBECC (Crustacean Biology, Ecology and Culture Study Group) in honor of its coordinators Dr. Adilson Fransozo and Dr. Maria Lucia Negreiros Fransozo.
